intro: Helianthemum praecox, commonly known as early rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully develop. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in a fine, fuzzy layer of hair. Helianthemum praecox thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
